intro: Lipotriche abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian lipotrich, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are often pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and prominent stamens. Lipotriche abyssinica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
